summary: Proposal to allow languages to customize package/namespace structure of generated proto APIs, specifically for .NET which currently requires importing many redundant `Temporal.Api.Xyz` namespaces. The author proposes consolidating into four main namespaces while keeping other languages unchanged.
userImpact: .NET developers would benefit from cleaner namespace imports and reduced verbosity in their codebase, though this is primarily a developer experience improvement.
rootCause: .NET proto compiler generates code based on proto package names and file structure, creating many redundant namespace imports across files when using multiple Temporal API types.
proposedFix: Allow language-specific customization of proto namespace via `option csharp_namespace`. Either PR #170 (rename message.proto files to unique names while keeping directory structure) or PR #171 (flatten files to single directory) while adjusting namespace options.
workaround: Use IDE features to auto-import namespaces, though this is inconsistent across environments and requires manual work for each file.
keyQuote: Most developers using some particular language come from not-yet-being Temporal-users to being Temporal-users in their preferred language of choice...language-specific improvements must be possible
